name: @local/app
author: <akauppi@gmail.com>
--: -- following stuff matters for development, only --

scripts.test: if port-is-free --silent 3000 ; then npm run _test_ci ; else npm run --silent _test_dev ; fi
scripts._test_ci: concurrently --kill-others --success=first -n dev,cy "npm run dev:local" "wait-for 3000 && cypress run"
scripts._test_dev: ( >&2 echo "Running Cypress against existing service." ) && cypress run
scripts.dev:local: concurrently --kill-others-on-fail -n emul,init "firebase emulators:start --project=app --only auth,functions,firestore" "npm run --silent _dev_local_init && npm run --silent _dev_local_vite"
scripts._checkNoLinks:
tools/check-no-links.sh || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: 'npm' links not allowed in a production build. Use them only at development.
	Use 'npm list' to see them; 'npm unlink x; npm install' to remove.
"; exit 8)
scripts.//_checkActivation:
check-activation || ( >&2 echo "ERROR: No active project. Please run 'npm run activate' at project root.
"; exit 1)

test: Made so that if 'npm run dev' is running, it automatically uses that. Otherwise (in CI/CD) launches and shuts down the emulators.
predev:local: 'firebase' CLI version (>= 8.15.0) matters for the use of auth emulation.

@vue/compiler-sfc: This needs to be the same version as 'dependencies.vue' but did not find a way to enforce that.
prettier: tbd. why do we have it? Keep, but mention here.
sass: Needed as a peer dep, since we use '<style scoped lang=scss>' in the application. Otherwise, there's a RED dialog

in the browser: '[plugin:vite:css] Preprocessor dependency "sass" not found. Did you install it?
'

engines: '--experimental-json-modules' seems to be available for Node 12
